text: if you feel like nothing you ever do is
making you feel truly happy this video
is for you we're often told do what
makes you happy and that happiness is
something we'll find once we get the
right job the perfect relationship or
the latest product but what if happiness
isn't just one thing and the happiness
we're chasing isn't even the kind that
lasts well the truth is there are are
several types of happiness but only one
of them lasts in this video we'll
explore why most of them fade and which
one is the key to Lasting
Joy the first is hedonic happiness
according to psychologist Emma sapala
this one is the happiness of indulgence
the joy of good food a fun night out or
a new purchase think about that Rush
when you buy something new like the
latest iPhone or a designer bag exciting
but it won't last while it feels great
in the moment it quickly Fades often
leaving us wanting more in a state
called the honic treadmill where we're
searching for the next high up next is
Flow State happiness Flow State
happiness happens when we are fully
immersed in an activity we love whether
it's painting writing or or playing
sports we lose ourselves in the moment
according to Mii chmi one of the
co-founders of positive psychology the
best moments in our lives are not the
passive receptive relaxing times the
best moments usually occur if a person's
body or mind is stretched to its limits
in a voluntary effort to accomplish
something difficult and worthwhile these
moments are deeply satisfying
but in the end they are just moments
they only last as long as the activity
does social happiness your connections
to others bring some of life's most
profound Joy friends family and
communities make us feel seen and loved
according to a Harvard study spanning
nearly 80 years strong relationships are
the key to
well-being but but placing all our
happiness in others hands can leave us
vulnerable what if family and friends
aren't readily
accessible that brings us to the next
Point gratitude induced happiness what
are three things you are grateful for in
your life right now like the warm
feeling when a friend surprises you with
a heartfelt thank you note being
grateful helps you see the beauty in
what you already have by reflecting On
Life's blessings you can shift Shi your
focus from what's missing to what's
present according to Amy e Keller s
experiencing gratitude activates
neurotransmitters like dopamine which we
associate with pleasure and serotonin
which regulates our mood it also causes
the brain to release oxytocin a hormone
that induces feelings like trust and
generosity which promotes social bonding
and feeling connected gratitude Fosters
a positive outlook but it takes
consistent practice to sustain before
you may become
desensitized are you finding this video
helpful leave a comment and share with a
friend anticipatory happiness according
to psychologist Simon AO imagining good
things ahead of us makes us feel better
in the current moment it can increase
motivation optimism and patience and
decrease
irritability recall the rush of
happiness you feel when you remember the
holiday season is around the Corner
sometimes the act of looking forward to
something a vacation a celebration a
movie release or even a quiet weekend
brings you a kind of excitement
anticipatory happiness is actually a
thing but it fades once the moment
arrives or
passes contentment
happiness contentment is the happiness
of being present and accepting life as
it is it's quiet calm and enduring but
due to overc consumerism and the natural
fear of missing out contentment
happiness requires effort to sustain
through mindfulness and
self-compassion also at some point we
still tend to want more out of life
which threatens the lifespan of this
type of
Happiness physical happiness the
happiness we feel after a workout or a
good night's sleep is no accident
physical happiness boosts endorphins and
promotes well-being research shows that
as little as 10 minute physical activity
per week or one day of Doing exercise
per week might result in increased
levels of happiness however it's still a
happiness that relies on external
conditions and doesn't last
indefinitely UD dionic happiness think
about the joy you feel when you achieve
a personal milestone in your creative or
Divine calling or or pour yourself into
work or a mission that feels truly
meaningful in making the world a better
place maybe it's the quiet peace that
comes from exploring your spiritual path
or finding a deeper connection to a
cause greater than yourself for example
UD demonic happiness could be a teacher
finding joy and helping students grow
and succeed or an artist feeling
fulfilled by creating work that Express
expresses their values and emotions
while also inspiring and helping others
who resonate with those same
values this is the happiness of meaning
and purpose often called spiritual
happiness it's a kind of fulfillment
that doesn't fade like monetary
Pleasures this happiness isn't about
external Rewards or fleeting moments
it's about finding purpose and who you
are and how you contribute to the world
around you you it connects you to
something deeper yourself others or even
the Divine and gives you a lasting sense
of peace and fulfillment this is the
kind of happiness that stands the test
of time and we're here to make one thing
crystal
clear you and every single one of us are
absolutely worthy of this lasting Joy so
ask yourself this
what is the very thing that brings
meaning and purpose to your life what
moments make you feel truly
alive what drives you to get up every
morning and keep going even when things
get
tough when you think about your deepest
values what comes to mind is it love is
it growth creativity or something else
entirely the answer answer to these
questions can guide you towards the
happiness that lasts you deserve it and
it's waiting for
you so do any of these types resonate
with you which one do you find yourself
